content: Updated: April 11, 2006 Search for a position in statistics

content: A candidate respectively earned a Master's degree in Pure Mathematics, a Master's degree in Applied Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics at the University of North Florida, and a Ph.D. degree in Statistics at the University of South Florida. For more than seven years he has been conducting research in statistics.For resume, please contact news@prochelp.com

content: Judge Technical Services seeks two (2) Senior SAS Clinical Programmers (10+ years experience) with knowledge of Web Interfaces and experience with SAS Integrated Technologies (v9.13). Will assist with developing web interfaces and reports using SAS; also responsible for collecting data, developing and modifying reports based on the Statistical Development Plan. Must have experience creating table listings and creating macros from scratch.

tag: html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
content: Required: Strong understanding of protocol development, SAS programming for Clinical Trials, Validation, 21CFR Part 11

content: Updated: February 16, 2006 Book Review: Sharpening Your SAS Skills by Sunil Gupta and Curt Edmonds

tag: html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
content: Book Review: Sharpening Your SAS Skills by Sunil Gupta and Curt Edmonds

tag: html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
content: This book is worth reading by all levels of SAS programmers but especially for the Beginner up to theIntermediate Levels. You should have some experience using the SAS software before picking up thisbook. It provides concise explanations, helpful examples and a nice summary section at the end of all sixchapters with the added benefit of some comprehensive questions with answers provided at the end of thebook.

tag: html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
content: Another added feature of this book for those who have not used SAS V9 or V8, is a section on theenhancements to these two SAS versions which should be helpful to those who have not had muchexperience with the new enhancements.

tag: html body text center font table tbody tr td font span
content: In reading this book, I uncovered a few new features of SAS that I was unaware of and immediatelythought of where I could utilize these new features and began employing them in my new code.This book is NOT intended to be a reference manual but the 273 pages can easily be read over severaldays and is helpful as a refresher course to reinforce your basic knowledge of SAS. It also provides agreat presentation and explanation on the PDV which I have not found in other books by SAS users.This is a book worth having in your SAS library to share with the rest of your staff who use the SASSoftware.
